intro: Elaphoglossum cerussatum subsp. cerussatum, commonly known as the rusty holly fern, is a species of fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, serrated fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are bioluminescent, emitting a faint glow in the dark due to the presence of luciferin. This unique trait makes it a rare and fascinating subject in botanical studies.
